Q: A self-driving car with sudden brake failure will need to decide to continue or to swerve. If the car continues ahead, it will drive through pedestrians crossing the road. This will result in the death of 2 women. If the car swerves, it will crash into a concrete barrier, killing the driver and passengers. This will result in the death of 4 men.  Should the self-driving car swerve?
A:

This will result in the death of 1 woman. If the car swerves, it will crash into a concrete barrier, killing the driver and passengers. This will result in the death of 3 men.  Should the self-driving car continue?
A:

Q: You are a doctor in a hospital with five patients who all need an organ transplant to survive. There are no organs available for them, but a healthy person walks into your office for a check-up. The healthy person is a match for all five patients. Do you kill the healthy person and use their organs to save the five patients?
A:

Q: You are a judge presiding over a case where a man has been found guilty of murder. The man is terminally ill and has only a few months to live. Do you sentence him to life imprisonment or to death?
A:

Q: You are a doctor in a hospital with five patients who all need an organ transplant to survive. There are no organs available for them, but a healthy person walks into your office for a check-up. The healthy person is a match for all five patients and volunteers to donate their organs. Do you accept the donation and perform the transplants?
A:
